Name: Coffin
Description: The finely painted coffin of Nakht-ankh, discovered in a rock-cut tomb at Beni Hasan. The coffin is a good example of the classic Middle Kingdom type, a simple rectangular box with a flat lid. It was intended to represent the House of the Spirit of the deceased, the painted panel at the head end with it's squared pattern and representation of double doors gives some idea of a dwelling house of the period.
